p: Phillygenin is the major active constituent of Fructus Forsythiae (Oleaceae). It can suppresses high glucose-induced lipid accumulation and it has antibacterial and antioxidant activities [ 56], and is could also be a potential therapeutic agent for alleviating inflammation [ 57]. Antiviral studies show that phillygenin has good protective effects against infections that are caused by IAV; it could reduce inflammation that is caused by IAV in vivo in the meanwhile [ 58].
